clinical_study.brief_title: Home Respiratory Polygraphy in Childhood Sleep Apnea-Hypopnea Syndrome (CHILDSLEEP).
clinical_study.official_title: Usefulness of Home Respiratory Polygraphy in the Diagnosis and Therapeutic Decision of Childhood Sleep Apnea-Hypopnea Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitario San Juan de Alicante

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitario San Juan de Alicante

brief_summary.textblock:
The aims of the study is to assess the diagnostic utility of home respiratory polygraphy (HRP) complemented with polysomnography (PSG) in childhood Obstructive Sleep Apnea-Hypopnea Syndrome (OSAS), as well as its usefulness in the therapeutic decisions.
Methods: Children referred with suspected OSAS will be evaluated during one year performing home respiratory polygraphy in all cases. PSG will be chosen in patients with concomitant pathology or according to medical criteria, or complemented with HRP in doubtful cases. Clinical and anthropometric data, severity, technical quality and treatment will be obtained. Patients will be divided in two groups (HRP vs PSG) and compared, and the accuracy from HRP to establish a therapeutic decision it wil calculated. The investigator's hypothesis is that PSG should be recommended only for complex or doubtful cases.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the diagnostic utility of home respiratory polygraphy (HRP) complemented with polysomnography (PSG) in childhood Obstructive Sleep Apnea-Hypopnea Syndrome (OSAS), as well as its usefulness in the therapeutic decisions.
primary_outcome.description: False negative and true positive diagnosis by home respiratory polygraphy

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the prevalence of childhood sleep apnea in Pneumology hospital consultations
secondary_outcome.description: Number of chlidhood sleep consultations related to adult consultations

arm_group.description: Group A: Children between 4 and 14 years-old with initial OSA suspicion there will be allocated to Home Respiratory Polygraphy (HRP)
Group B: Children between 4 and 14 years-old with initial OSA suspicion and concommitant diseases and false negative suspicion from HRP there will allocated to Hospital Nocturnal Polysomnography

intervention.description: Home respiratory polygraphy or Polysomnography to stablish a therapeutic decission

study_pop.textblock: Children submited to Pneumology Service with sleep apnea suspicion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sleep apnea suspicion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other sleep conditions
- Non valid home respiratory polygraphy and non valid polysomnography in the same patient
- Non informated consent
